summaries.body: Support for Bernie Sanders is low on the campus of Wellesley College, Hillary Rodham Clinton's alma mater. But a small group of students is trying to change that.

display_asset.caption: From left, the Mudd Club owner Steve Mass (in cap), Debbie Harry, Kate Pierson and Richard Boch, the Mudd Club’s longtime doorman.
display_asset.credit: Christian Hansen for The New York Times

summaries.body: A one-night revival of the iconic '80s club, the Mudd Club, reunited clubgoers who remembered the New York City spot as the gritty alternative to Studio 54.

display_asset.caption: Stedman Bailey during a game against the Minnesota Vikings on Nov. 8. He had 12 receptions so far this season.

summaries.body: Stedman Bailey, 25, a receiver for the St. Louis Rams, was in critical condition after he was shot in Florida on Tuesday evening, ESPN reported.
A Belgian court sentenced the comedian Dieudonné M’bala M’bala to two months in prison over anti-Semitic remarks he made during a 2012 show.

display_asset.caption: A woman, who was seen on video, arrived at the Holy Jesus Child Church in Richmond Hill, Queens, on Monday with a newborn, who was left behind in an empty manger scene.

summaries.body: An hours-old baby, his umbilical cord still attached, was left in a Nativity scene at a Queens church. Detectives were trying to speak with a woman seen on video with the child.

display_asset.caption: President Park Geun-hye of South Korea.

summaries.body: South Korea's government is trying to secure the freedom of nine North Koreans, including a baby, who a rights group said were in danger of facing harsh punishment for leaving the North.
Scientists are baffled by why 250 sick or dead sea otters have washed up this year on Alaska’s southern coast. Some say a virus may be decimating the animals’ ranks.

display_asset.caption: Recipients included, from right, Barbra Streisand, Steven Spielberg, Stephen Sondheim, Lee H. Hamilton and Peggen Frank, who received the medal for her father, Billy Frank Jr.

summaries.body: The Presidential Medal of Freedom was awarded on Tuesday to an eclectic mix of Americans, including Willie Mays, Barbra Streisand and Steven Spielberg.

display_asset.credit: Isaac Brekken for The New York Times

summaries.body: A 14-year-old boy solved a Rubik's Cube in less than five seconds last weekend, breaking the world record.

display_asset.caption: The Times’s Florence Fabricant gives etiquette advice for entertaining on Thanksgiving.
display_asset.title: How to Host Thanksgiving: Dos and Don'ts

summaries.body: Feel free to cover your Thanksgiving table with a bed sheet, but don't even think about putting out paper napkins. Our etiquette expert has plenty of tips.
Adele’s new album “25” sold more than two million copies in just a few days. But it is largely absent from one of the world's top music piracy sites.

display_asset.caption: The pigeons' training environment at the University of Iowa included a food pellet dispenser, a touch-sensitive screen that projected medical images, and blue and yellow choice buttons on either side.

summaries.body: Pigeons, with their excellent vision, can be trained to tell the difference between malignant and benign breast tumors by looking at a mammogram, researchers found.

display_asset.caption: Blue Origin's reusable New Shepard rocket successfully landed after a test launch on Monday.

summaries.body: A rocket launched by Blue Origin, the Amazon founder Jeffrey P. Bezos’s company, reached outer space and then returned to its launchpad in one piece.

display_asset.credit: Cheryl Senter for The New York Times

summaries.body: For women getting in vitro fertilization treatment, too much of a commonly used hormone decreases the chance of conceiving, a new study says.
Newly released emails reveal how Coke helped shape the mission of a nonprofit aimed at combating obesity after the soft drink giant gave the group $1.5 million.

display_asset.caption: To combat food waste, Imperfect Produce, a San Francisco Bay Area start-up, sells fresh fruits and vegetables that never make it to grocery store shelves.
display_asset.title: Edible, but Ugly

summaries.body: To combat food waste, a San Francisco Bay Area start-up is selling fresh, yet odd-looking, produce that never makes it to grocery store shelves.

display_asset.caption: A plan to eradicate the state’s 2,200 mute swans was changed to emphasize non-deadly control methods.

summaries.body: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has vetoed a bill that would have suspended a program to cull the population of mute swans, which New York state officials say are an invasive species.
Not all of the Islamic State’s propaganda is fearsome and barbaric. Some of the imagery it disseminates is so benign that it would not seem out of place in a car commercial.

display_asset.caption: Jack Ma, the founder and chief executive of the Chinese Internet giant Alibaba.

summaries.body: Jack Ma, chairman of the Chinese Internet giant Alibaba Group, is in talks to buy The South China Morning Post, an influential English-language newspaper in Hong Kong.

display_asset.caption: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, left, with President François Hollande of France in Paris on Monday.

summaries.body: Prime Minister David Cameron says he will add about $18 billion to Britain's military spending over the next decade.
Lawyers for Ahmed Mohamed, the teenager arrested after bringing a clock to school, sent letters to the city and school district of Irving, Tex., seeking $15 million in damages.
The author Joyce Carol Oates was criticized after she posed a question on Twitter: Is nothing "joyous" in the Islamic State?

display_asset.credit: Raymond McCrea Jones for The New York Times

summaries.body: Josh Adams owed $30,000 to friends and family when he finally decided to face his gambling addiction. Then he discovered fantasy sports.

display_asset.credit: Morgan Rachel Levy for The New York Times

summaries.body: A yoga class at the University of Ottawa was suspended this semester for what student leaders said were issues related to “cultural appropriation.”
Justin Bieber’s "Purpose" debuted at No. 1, as the pop star’s new album outsold One Direction’s “Made in the A.M.” on the Billboard chart.

display_asset.caption: The Nets are "focusing on trying to gain younger assets," which they could possibly do by trading Brook Lopez, left, and Joe Johnson, right.

summaries.body: The Nets' 2013 trade with the Celtics for Paul Pierce and Kevin Garnett seems to be getting worse by the game, Harvey Araton writes.
The Théâtre du Châtelet’s production of “Singin’ in the Rain” is scheduled to come to Broadway from Paris next fall.
Two cubs from the ice age from an extinct species of lion​ were recently uncovered in Siberia, perfectly frozen in the permafrost.

display_asset.credit: Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News, via AP

summaries.body: The Department of Veterans Affairs is mired in a backlog of more than 425,000 appeals of disputed claims.
The writer-artist Frank Miller returns to Batman with "Dark Knight III: The Master Race," a comic book series whose first issue will be released on Wednesday.
